net.grinder.tools.tcpproxy
Class TCPProxySSLSocketFactoryImplementation

java.lang.Object
  net.grinder.tools.tcpproxy.TCPProxySSLSocketFactoryImplementation
All Implemented Interfaces:
TCPProxySocketFactory, TCPProxySSLSocketFactory
public final class TCPProxySSLSocketFactoryImplementation
extends Object
implements TCPProxySSLSocketFactory

TCPProxySocketFactory for SSL connections.

ARGHH. I hate JSSE.

The JSSE docs rabbit on about being able to create factories with the required parameters, this is a lie. Where is "SSL[Server]SocketFactory.setEnabledCipherSuites()"? Hence the need for our own abstract factories.

We can't install our own TrustManagerFactory without messing with the security properties file. Hence we create our own SSLContext and initialise it.

- PhilA

Author:
Philip Aston, Phil Dawes

                                              String keyStoreType)
                                       throws IOException,
                                              GeneralSecurityException,
                                              SSLContextFactory.SSLContextFactoryException
Construct a TCPProxySSLSocketFactoryImplementation that uses the specified key store.

Parameters:
keyStoreFile - Key store file.
keyStorePassword - Key store password, or null if no password.
keyStoreType - Key store type, or null if the default keystore type should be used.
Throws:
IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
GeneralSecurityException - If a security error occurs.
SSLContextFactory.SSLContextFactoryException - If SSLContext could not be created.

createClientSocket

public Socket createClientSocket(Socket existingSocket,
                                 EndPoint remoteEndPoint)
                          throws IOException

Factory method for client sockets that are layered over existing sockets. Used to establish HTTPS proxy connections.

The SSL socket takes ownership of the existing socket; when the SSL socket is closed, the existing socket will also be closed.

Specified by:
createClientSocket in interface TCPProxySSLSocketFactory
Parameters:
existingSocket - The existing socket.
remoteEndPoint - Remote host and port. Not the proxy. As far as I can gather, the JSSE does not use this information.
Returns:
A new Socket.
Throws:
IOException - If an error occurs.
